text:
[SQUEAKING]
[RUSTLING] [CLICKING]

VICTOR ODUMUYIWA:
Faculty in the university

are playing a very
important role

because you mold the
future of your nation

and what our nation will become
based on the kind of graduates
you produce.

I think this should be a
platform that every faculty all

over the world that wants to
be the best in what they do

should look at it
and adapt the content

and have their own innovative
ideas to the content.

AMIR BATURE: How do you show
them how the test of real life
is?

We do that by the laboratories,
either simulation laboratories

or real life,
practical laboratories

because things to do but is
already done for you in OCW.

All you have to do is just
do, so a few modification,
and there you are.
You have it.

OLUSOJI ILORI: We
need [INAUDIBLE]

to have at least a foundation
in being able to design a chip.
So we actually adopted the OCW.
We adopted it completely.

So at the MIT, you have
two or three instructors
who are the best in that field.

And then they have
support staffs,

like graduate assistants,
graduate teaching assistants.

Graduates are-- they have
graders and all that.

So it's like you have a whole
team teaching the course.

So the pace at MIT for
that course is very fast.
So now, bring it back here.

So you have only me
teaching the course.

There's no way I
don't match that.

VICTOR ODUMUYIWA: So at first
when I brought in the content

from the OCW, it kind
of raised some questions

or some complaints
from the students

because it's like
adding more activities
or tasks to what they do.

So it's like they feel
that, why are you taking us
through this stressful path?

As at that time,
the current markets

of the market in our
country was not--

the demand were not too
rigorous compared to now.

Yeah, so [INAUDIBLE]
that for them

to be globally
competitive, they need

to have best practices
based on that

and master the concept
and the models.

OLUSOJI ILORI: So what we did
was that we splitted the course
into two semesters.

So that reduced the
pace and give more room
to do a lot of things.

VICTOR ODUMUYIWA: The
goal of the courses,

to train students to write
self-developed software that

are free from bugs, ready for
change and easy to understand.

That phrase alone changes
a lot of things when
we start [INAUDIBLE] classes.

And we know that
these are focused.

This changes a lot of
things about the perception

of student, about preparation,
and about the goal

and objectives of
the students as well.

AMIR BATURE: Now, I want to
follow the Bloom taxonomy aim

of teaching, not just for
students to understand, no,

but how can we go up
to the grade level.
Before, that's not what we have.

It's just a bunch of
materials and mathematics

that will go to class and just
teach from there till the exam.

They will cram what they know
and act them and pass it.

So now I try to
make it different.

OLUSOJI ILORI: So that's
why I stress high quality.

OCW materials can really,
not only the student,

they can also help
you as educator

to learn because it was
a new field for me, too.

So I needed to actually
learn and actually make
learning those things easier.

AMIR BATURE: In junior
than going to the class

and participating, seeing
the real life problem,

going to the lab experiencing
the problem, sleeping on it,

and tomorrow, go to the
class, using theory,
and solve the problem.

It gives you more intuition
of being an engineer.

Just streaming YouTube videos
and taking some online courses

doesn't get too near
to the real life thing.

VICTOR ODUMUYIWA: Apart from
adding to your students,

it's going to really
add to you as a faculty

because you're going
to be challenged
by the kind of content you see.

It's going to
challenge you first

to make sure you master your
field, your own content,
your own courses.

If you have any
challenge, just reach out

to ETT Fellows in university or
in your neighboring university.

They should be able to help you
because they have an experience
using this platform.

OLUSOJI ILORI: And
the other thing

is you also need to assess if
the objective of that course

aligns with your own program
because some courses are

designed with some objectives in
mind, which is not necessarily

yours, or you don't
have all the objective.
So you need to know.
You need to be aware.

AMIR BATURE: And that's
where OCW comes into play.

VICTOR ODUMUYIWA: Exposing
your students to OCW resources

will make them to be
globally competitive.

AMIR BATURE: This
alignment of the course

is left for every
lecturer to do it.

It's something that
have to take years

of experience and feedback
for you to achieve.

So OCW will be a great help
in helping you I to that.

OLUSOJI ILORI: So
to me, OER generally

is valuable in the sense
that it gives students access

to the body of knowledge
in the field they
are going to specialize in.

Essentially, they are
going for research,

and also give them access to
the top experts in those fields.

So they are aware
of current thinking.

They are aware of what
the trends in that field

are going to be, and
they are prepared for it.

AMIR BATURE: So a
lot of this is what

keeps us inspired in
the teaching line,

seeing that some
of your students
are having a very good outcome.

It makes you know that
their future is promised.
[MUSIC PLAYING]
